title: Why do objects move in different ways? Why are some objects faster than the other? - Quora

response.answer_text: Inertia! Depending on how much stuff is in an object, it takes more or less force to move it. If you have an object of mass m, and another object of mass 2m, it will take twice the force to accelerate 2m, to match the acceleration of the same force on m.
